instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: MacBook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2013 display flickering
threads.message:
Please find the attached video link, I don't know why it is flickering intermediately. Did anybody faced this issue ? 
I have checked with external screen but I can't see flickering in the external monitor but the internal one is flickering.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-VXLh9OyqQYgah3ML84BtnXS_hV_sVSR[/URL]

threads.title: MacBook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2013 display flickering
threads.message: Forgot to tell, I was changed the battery, did I screwed the display because of pressure on it?

threads.title: MacBook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2013 display flickering
threads.message:
Looks like screen problem.
You should test with known good one.

threads.title: MacBook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2013 display flickering
threads.message: It is not happening always, it's happening when I keep it long time in cupboard. Something related to temperature I think. Will display performance impact depends on temperature? Yesterday whole night laptop was outside and it was ON. Today I don't see this flickering anymore
